Value.label: LED Light
Value.Help: Sets when the LED on the outlet is lit.

Value.label: LED Indication Configuration
Value.Help: Adjust the LED status to default, invert, always OFF or always ON

Item.label: Device is ON, LED is OFF; device is OFF, LED is ON
Device is ON, LED is ON; device is OFF, LED is OFF

Value.label: Dim up/down rate
Value.Help: Adjust the speed at which the ramps to a specific value other than 0 and FF

Item.label: Dim up/down the light to the specified level quickly by command except value 0 and FF
Dim up/down the light to the specified level slowly by command except value 0 and ff

Value.label: Switch Mode
Value.Help: Turn your dimmer into an On/Off switch with switch mode

Value.label: Alternate Exclusion
Value.Help: Never accidentally remove a device during with alternate exclusion

Item.label: Normal operation, press any button on the device
Press two times ON button and two times OFF button, LED will flash 5 times if exclusion is successful

Value.label: Minimum Dim Threshold
Value.Help: Set the minimum dimmer threshold

Value.label: Maximum Brightness Threshold
Value.Help: Set the brightness threshold

Value.label: Default Brightness Level
Value.Help: Set the default brightness level that the dimmer will turn on when being controlled manually

Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Switch / Input Type for IN1
Value.Help: Switch / Input Type for IN1. Choose the input/switch type you want to connect to the IN1 terminal. Default: momentary switch

Item.label: toggle switch (on when swithc is on)

Value.label: Switch / Input Type for IN2
Value.Help: Switch / Input Type for IN2. Choose the input/switch type you want to connect to the IN2 terminal. Default: momentary switch

Item.label: toggle switch (on when swithc is on)

Value.label: Switch / Input Type for IN3
Value.Help: Switch / Input Type for IN3. Choose the input/switch type you want to connect to the IN3 terminal. Default: momentary switch

Item.label: toggle switch (on when swithc is on)

Value.label: Switch / Input Type for IN4
Value.Help: Switch / Input Type for IN4. Choose the input/switch type you want to connect to the IN4 terminal. Default: momentary switch

Item.label: toggle switch (on when swithc is on)

Value.label: Scene Control for IN1
Value.Help: Assign scene activation trigger for IN1 terminal. Default: Everything

Value.label: Scene Control for IN2
Value.Help: Assign scene activation trigger for IN2 terminal. Default: Everything

Value.label: Scene Control for IN3
Value.Help: Assign scene activation trigger for IN3 terminal. Default: Everything

Value.label: Scene Control for IN4
Value.Help: Assign scene activation trigger for IN4 terminal. Default: Everything

Value.label: Power Report Frequency
Value.Help: Power Report Frequency. Choose how often you want your RGBW Dimmer to report power consumption (W) to your controller. NOTE: must be 0, or an increment of 30. Default: 3600

Value.label: Energy Report Threshold
Value.Help: Energy Report Threshold. Choose how you want your RGBW Dimmer to report energy use (kWh) to your hub. The number entered as value corresponds to decimal values in energy useage change. So if 10 is entered by default, the RGBW Dimmer will report any change in energy use over 0.1 kWh. Energy reports are sent in t least 30-second intervals.

Value.label: Energy Report Frequency
Value.Help: Energy Report Frequency. Choose how often you want your RGBW Dimmer to report energy (kWh) to your controller. NOTE: must be 0, or an increment of 30. Default: 3600

Value.label: RGBW/HSB Wall Switch Mode
Value.Help: RGBW/HSB Wall Switch Mode. Choose how switches connected to the input terminals control your LED strip. In the default RGBW mode, each switch connected to each input terminal controls the RGBW chnnels separately (so IN1 for red, IN2 for green, etc.) with a single click for ON/OFF, double click to full brightness, and press-and-hold to dim (momentary switches only). In the HSB, IN1 controls hue, IN2 - saturation, IN3 - brightness, IN4 - white with single click for last set value or value 0, double click to max value, and press-and-hold to set custom value. Default: RGBW mode

Value.label: Ramp Rate (switch)
Value.Help: Ramp Rate (switch). Adjust the ramp rate for your RGBW dimmer (fade-in/fade-out effect for on/off operation). Values correspond to the number of seconds it takes for the dimmer to reach full brightness or turn off when operated from the connected wall switch. Note that 0 is instant on/off. Default : 3 seconds

Value.label: Ramp Rate (Z-Wave)
Value.Help: Ramp Rate (Z-Wave). Adjust the ramp rate for your RGBW dimmer (fade-in/fade-out effect for on/off operation). Values correspond to the number of seconds it takes for the dimmer to reach full brightness or turn off when operated remotely from the Z-Wave hub Note that 0 is instant on/off. Default : 3 seconds

Value.label: Preset Programs
Value.Help: Enable one of the preset animated color programs to set the mood with a click. Default: preset programs disabled

Value.label: On Off Status After Power Failure
Value.Help: On Off Status After Power Failure. Default: forced to OFF

Value.Help: Switch / Input Type for IN1. Choose the input/switch type you want to connect to the IN1 terminal. Default: momentary switch

Value.Help: Assign scene activation trigger for IN4 terminal. Default: Everything

Value.label: Power Report Frequency
Value.Help: Power Report Frequency. Choose how often you want your RGBW Dimmer to report power consumption (W) to your controller. NOTE: must be 0, or an increment of 30. Default: 3600

Value.label: Energy Report Threshold
Value.Help: Energy Report Threshold. Choose how you want your RGBW Dimmer to report energy use (kWh) to your hub. The number entered as value corresponds to decimal values in energy useage change. So if 10 is entered by default, the RGBW Dimmer will report any change in energy use over 0.1 kWh. Energy reports are sent in t least 30-second intervals.

Value.label: Energy Report Frequency
Value.Help: Energy Report Frequency. Choose how often you want your RGBW Dimmer to report energy (kWh) to your controller. NOTE: must be 0, or an increment of 30. Default: 3600

Value.label: RGBW/HSB Wall Switch Mode
Value.Help: RGBW/HSB Wall Switch Mode. Choose how switches connected to the input terminals control your LED strip. In the default RGBW mode, each switch connected to each input terminal controls the RGBW chnnels separately (so IN1 for red, IN2 for green, etc.) with a single click for ON/OFF, double click to full brightness, and press-and-hold to dim (momentary switches only). In the HSB, IN1 controls hue, IN2 - saturation, IN3 - brightness, IN4 - white with single click for last set value or value 0, double click to max value, and press-and-hold to set custom value. Default: RGBW mode

Value.label: Ramp Rate (switch)
Value.Help: Ramp Rate (switch). Adjust the ramp rate for your RGBW dimmer (fade-in/fade-out effect for on/off operation). Values correspond to the number of seconds it takes for the dimmer to reach full brightness or turn off when operated from the connected wall switch. Note that 0 is instant on/off. Default : 3 seconds

Value.label: Ramp Rate (Z-Wave)
Value.Help: Ramp Rate (Z-Wave). Adjust the ramp rate for your RGBW dimmer (fade-in/fade-out effect for on/off operation). Values correspond to the number of seconds it takes for the dimmer to reach full brightness or turn off when operated remotely from the Z-Wave hub Note that 0 is instant on/off. Default : 3 seconds

Value.label: Preset Programs
Value.Help: Enable one of the preset animated color programs to set the mood with a click. Default: preset programs disabled

Value.Help: Adjust the LED status to default, invert, always OFF or always ON

Value.Help: Turn your dimmer into an On/Off switch with switch mode

Value.Help: Never accidentally remove a device during with alternate exclusion

Item.label: Normal operation, press any button on the device
Press two times ON button and two times OFF button, LED will flash 5 times if exclusion is successful

Value.label: Minimum Dim Threshold
Value.Help: Set the minimum dimmer threshold

Value.label: Maximum Brightness Threshold
Value.Help: Set the brightness threshold

Value.label: Default Brightness Level
Value.Help: Set the default brightness level that the dimmer will turn on when being controlled manually

Value.label: LED Light
Value.Help: Sets when the LED on the outlet is lit.

Value.label: In-wall Switch Type for Load to control I1
Value.Help: With this parameter, you can select between push-button (momentary) and on/off toggle switch types.

Value.label: Working mode
Value.Help: With this parameter, you can change the device presentation on the user interface.

Value.label: Turn Load 1 Off Automatically with Timer
Value.Help: 0 - Auto OFF Disabled. 1 - 32536 = 1 - 32536 seconds - Auto OFF timer enabled for a given amount of seconds. Default value 0.

Value.label: Turn Load 1 On Automatically with Timer
Value.Help: 0 - Auto ON Disabled. 1 - 32536 = 1 - 32536 seconds - Auto ON timer enabled for a given amount of seconds. Default value 0.

Value.label: Double click function
Value.Help: If the Double click function is enabled, a fast double click on the push-button will set the dimming level to the maximum dimming value.

Value.label: Restore on/off status for load after power failure
Value.Help: Default value 0.

Item.label: Device saves last on/off status and restores it after a power failure
Device does not save on/off status

Value.label: Watt Power Consumption Reporting Threshold for Load
Value.Help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0% - 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 5.

Value.label: Watt Power Consumption Reporting Time Threshold for Load
Value.Help: Set value means time interval (0 - 32767) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 second to 32767 seconds reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s).

Value.label: Minimum dimming value
Value.Help: 1 - 98 = 1% - 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 1 (Minimum dimming value is 1%).

Value.label: Maximum dimming value
Value.Help: 2 - 99 = 2% - 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 99 (Maximum dimming value is 99%).

Value.label: Dimming time (soft on/off)
Value.Help: Set value means time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max. dimming values by short press of push button I1 or controlled through the controller. 1 - 127 = 1 second - 127 seconds. Default value 1 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 1s).

Value.label: Dimming time when key hold
Value.Help: Choose the time during which the Dimmer will move between the min. and max. dimming values during a continuous press of the push-button I1, by an associated device or through the UI controls (BasicSet, SwitchMultilevelSet) default value 3 = 3s. 1-127 = 1 second – 127 seconds. 128 – 253 = 1 minute – 126 minutes.

Value.label: Ignore start level
Value.Help: Choose whether the device should use (or disregard) the start dimming level value. If the device is configured to use the start level, it should start the dimming process from the currently set dimming level. This parameter is used with association group 3

Value.label: Dimming duration
Value.Help: Choose the time during which the device will transition from the current value to the new target value. This parameter applies to the association group 3. default value 0 (dimming duration according to parameter 66). 1 - 127 (from 1 to 127 seconds).

Value.label: Overload safety switch
Value.Help: The function allows for turning off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power for more than 5s. Controlled device can be turned back on by input I1 or sending a control frame. 0 = function not active 1–200=1W–200W

Value.label: Calibration trigger
Value.Help: Choose when will be the calibration procedure triggered.

Item.label: Calibration done after power cycle if module is excluded
Calibration done after power cycle regardless of inclusion status

Value.label: Calibration trigger
Value.Help: Whit this parameter you can check the calibration status.

Value.label: Alarm/Notification events
Value.Help: This parameter defines the module behaviour in case it receives any Alarm/Notification events.

Value.label: Alarm/Notification time interval
Value.Help: This parameter defines the time interval of the blinking state, once the module receives an alarm/notification event. Minimum step increase is 1 minute. 1 - 127 (from 1 to 125 minutes).

Value.label: On/Off Status Recovery After Power Failure
Value.Help: Status after Power Failure

Value.label: Power Wattage Report Value Threshold
Value.Help: 0 = power meter disabled; 1-65535 = value in watts for report threshold

Value.label: Power Wattage Report Frequency
Value.Help: 0 = disabled; 30-2678400 = time in seconds to send power wattage report

Value.label: Energy (kWh) Report Frequency
Value.Help: 0 = disabled; 30-2678400 = time in seconds to send energy report

Value.label: Overload Protection
Value.Help: 0 = disabled; 1-1800 = value in watts for overload protection

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH1
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH1

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH1
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-off timer for CH1, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH1
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH1

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH1
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-on timer for CH1, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH2
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH2

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH2
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-off timer for CH2, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH2
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH2

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH2
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-on timer for CH2, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH3
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH3

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH3
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-off timer for CH3, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH3
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH3

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH3
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-on timer for CH3, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH4
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH4

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH4
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-off timer for CH4, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH4
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH4

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH4
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-on timer for CH4, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH5
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH5

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH5
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-off timer for CH5, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH5
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH5

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH5
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-on timer for CH5, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Manual Control
Value.Help: Enable or Disable Manual Controll for out Outlets

Value.label: LED Indicator Mode
Value.Help: Normal = LED indicator is on when power is on, off when power is off. Inverse = LED indicator is off when power is on, and on when power is off. Always Off = LED indicator is always off, regardless of power status.

Value.label: On Off Status After Power Failure
Value.Help: On Off Status After Power Failure. Default: forced to OFF

Value.label: Switch / Input Type for IN1
Value.Help: Switch / Input Type for IN1. Choose the input/switch type you want to connect to the IN1 terminal. Default: momentary switch

Item.label: toggle switch (on when swithc is on)

Value.Help: Switch / Input Type for IN2. Choose the input/switch type you want to connect to the IN2 terminal. Default: momentary switch

Value.Help: Switch / Input Type for IN3. Choose the input/switch type you want to connect to the IN3 terminal. Default: momentary switch

Value.Help: Switch / Input Type for IN4. Choose the input/switch type you want to connect to the IN4 terminal. Default: momentary switch

Item.label: toggle switch (on when swithc is on)

So if 10 is entered by default, the RGBW Dimmer will report any change in energy use over 0.1 kWh. Energy reports are sent in t least 30-second intervals.
